A stunning example of Parisian architecture, Pont d'Austerlitz is a must-visit for anyone visiting the City of Lights. This iconic bridge offers breathtaking views of the Seine River and the surrounding cityscape. The ambiance is peaceful and romantic, making it an ideal spot for a leisurely stroll or a picnic with loved ones.  The bridge's design is a perfect blend of historical and modern elements, making it an architectural masterpiece. The service provided by the staff is excellent, and they go out of their way to make visitors feel welcome. The bridge is well-maintained, and the quality of the experience offered is exceptional.  What sets Pont d'Austerlitz apart from other bridges in Paris is its unique history and location. It was constructed in the early 1800s, making it one of the oldest bridges in the city. It connects the 5th and 12th arrondissements and provides a crucial transportation link between the two.  There are no complaints or criticisms about this beautiful bridge, making it worthy of a perfect 5-star rating. However, it would be even better if more seating areas were added for visitors to relax and enjoy the views.  Overall, I would highly recommend Pont d'Austerlitz to anyone looking for a quintessential Parisian experience. This bridge is a true gem in the heart of the city, and I will undoubtedly return in the future. Thank you to the owners and staff for maintaining such a beautiful landmark.

Super bridge that I have the chance to cross every morning and that I rediscover each time in a magnificent light! Whether on one side or the other, this bridge offers a superb view of Paris and allows you to take magnificent photos at any time of the day! However, for the brave, the best time remains the sunrise when it comes out of the horizon to caress your face!

Bridge connecting the Jardin des Plantes to the right bank, the Gare de Lyon, but above all the port of the arsenal and the Bastille district. Very nice walk to do.

Parisian bridge connecting the Jardin des Plantes to the Gare de Lyon. The interest, apart from its architecture, is the view it offers over the Seine. A real postcard landscape, always different depending on the light. Today, the trend is gray which does not detract from the view from the bridge.
I like this bridge with very beautiful arches. We have a beautiful view of the metro 5 viaduct. I like to see the metro passing by as it rushes up to Austerlitz station.

Pont d'Austerlitz This is a stone arch bridge spanning the Seine River, built in 1807. The bridges on the Seine River are all well-designed bridges that captivate you with their history and scenery. As a civil engineer, I am deeply impressed.

The Austerlitz bridge, made of masonry and with a current length of 174 m and a width of 30 m, was rebuilt in 1854-1855. it has five circular arches, circular spouts, tympanums sculpted by Hamel and a stone balustrade. The width was increased from 18 m to 30 m during the years 1883 to 1885.
often confused with the viaduct of the same name it faces Boulevard Ledru Rollin.

The Pont d'Austerlitz is an emblematic bridge in Paris, which spans the Seine and connects the districts of the Right Bank and the Left Bank. It was inaugurated in 1807 during the reign of Napoleon Bonaparte and takes its name from the famous Battle of Austerlitz.
